resources.string: Discovered in Wuhan, China in December of 2019, COVID-19 is an infectious disease caused by the coronavirus strain.\n

Commonly a fever, tiredness and a dry cough are symptoms of COVID-19 though there may be an incubation period of up to 14 days. Less common symptoms include aching, nasal congestion, sore throat or diarrhea. Approximately 1 in 6 people become seriously ill and have breathing difficulties.\n
How can I prevent the spread of COVID-19?
Regularly wash your hands, maintain social distancing, avoid touching your face, self-isolate if necessary and keep updated on COVID-19â€™s severity in your area.\n
Currently there is no vaccine or antibiotics to treat COVID-19, with the current preventative measure being admitted quarantines after testing.\n
Are facemasks effective against preventing the spread of COVID-19?

Only in situations where either you are exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19 or if you are looking after someone who is ill. Be mindful in the wastage of disposable facemasks as there have been shortages of them.
